sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A pious and Christian consideration of life and death and of all humane actions. Written originally in French by the famous Philip Morney Lord of Plessis. Translated into Latin by Arnoldus Freitagius. And now done into English by M. A. for the benefit of his countrymen. Excellent discours de la vie et de la mort. English Mornay, Philippe de, seigneur du Plessis-Marly, 1549-1623. Freitag, Arnold. M., A.
70, [2] p.
printed by J. L. for Luke Meredith, at the Star in St. Paul's Church-yard, London : 1699.
A translation of: Mornay, Philippe de, seigneur du Plessis-Marly. Excellent discours de la vie et de la mort. Caption title on p. 3 reads: A Godly and Christian consideration of life and death. With a final advertisement leaf. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A pious and Christian consideration of life and death and of all humane actions. Written originally in French by the famous Philip Morney Lord of Plessis. Translated into Latin by Arnoldus Freitagius. And now done into English by M. A. for the benefit of his countrymen. Excellent discours de la vie et de la mort. English Mornay, Philippe de, seigneur du Plessis-Marly, 1549-1623. Freitag, Arnold. M., A.
70, [2] p.
printed by J. L. for Luke Meredith, at the Star in St. Paul's Church-yard, London : 1699.
A translation of: Mornay, Philippe de, seigneur du Plessis-Marly. Excellent discours de la vie et de la mort. Caption title on p. 3 reads: A Godly and Christian consideration of life and death. With a final advertisement leaf. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Luke Meredith
J. L.
the Star in St. Paul's Church-yard
